pros: In my opinion, management has been very fair and supportive. They recognize people when they work hard and they also recognize individuals that do not. The work environment feels like family. People do not mind if you need help. Pay is good and also VNA is non profit so they allow more opportunities to help patients and families.
cons: There have been some lay offs due to changes in company and contracts. Some good people were let go. However SOME of the individuals they have let go appeared to be the ones that were not doing their job well.

pros: Has its ups and downs. The staff are great to work with.
cons: A lot of turnover lately. Management has changed so much, it’s hard getting a new boss every few months. No merit increase in years.
Limited staffing, vacations hard to get

job_title: Private Duty HHA in Claremont, CA
pros: The clients I got to take care of were always nice and the families were great. I rarely had any problems.
cons: The people in the office are relentless when it comes to trying to get you to accept a job. It doesn't seem to matter to them if you have to drive 3 miles or 30 miles. They guilt trip you into taking clients, even after you tell them you can't. If you have a full time job and use this place as a second job, beware. They would call me early in the morning when I was still asleep (I worked nights at my full time job) and they'd call me while I was at work. They'll call you 8 or 9 times and then text you if you don't get back to them right away.

review_title: Employee of approx 1 year now in High Desert location and don't regret the decision to work here for even one second.
job_title: Staff RN in Apple Valley, CA
pros: Great team work, flexible schedule, minimal on call or weekend shifts, manageable case loads make it easy to be highly productive while giving excellent care. Ray Vick the director  empowers the staff without micromanaging. Being able to provide excellent care to patients knowing management thinks of the patient first and not the bottom dollar.
cons: Pay scale seems low. Veteran staff feel raises are slow in coming with poor recognition from CEO on meeting goals and providing excellent care. I have yet to be employed a year to voice an opinion on this.

review_title: Wonderful people and service provided by co workers...in spite of upper managements micromanaging.
job_title: Hospice Social Worker in Claremont, CA
pros: Great patient service provided; wonderful co workers.
cons: Upper administration is extremely rigid and micromanaging.

job_title: RN Case Manager in San Bernardino, CA
pros: Good benefits for full time employees, have a lot of patient referrals, provide nurses with supplies needed in patient care, good pay.
cons: Just keeps accepting patients even when there is not enough staff/nurses to cover the need/demand, too wide of coverage are, high patient acuity. No room for professional growth, quick turn over because staff overwhelmed with schedule or patient assignments.

job_title: RN Case Manager in San Bernardino, CA
pros: The patients are wonderful! Professional coworkers share a true compassion and care for the patients!
cons: Supervisors are micromanagers and constantly demean the professional staff! Recently changed company name and website address to avoid bad reviews.

After  many years with the company over 5yrs i  only got a 2%  raise.  Due to low hourly wage I don't feel valued for what I do.  I have to work overtime to make what others just entering are making.
It's a nonprofit company with past budgeting issues.  Even mileage is less than  IRS average.   I just want a fair wage.  Maybe it's time to go!

pros: Patient care is really the only great thing about working at VNA ....
cons: Long term employees are not valued,  low paying wages, administrative staff has horrible attitude and are not professional,  upper management is unworthy and useless, no growth within the organization, over worked staff, no proper training for job success, company values are not ever met, no wonder so many great employees have left.

pros: The staff truly care about one another, where management clearly does not care.   Employee recognition from employee to employee was awesome!  The location is great with access to the metrolink and lots of great shops/restaurants in Claremont.
cons:
The management was the absolute worst.  The CEO, CFO and VPs were constantly out on LOA, sick or vacation.  This behavior was not acceptable by non-management staff.  Additionally, when they were in the office, they were in very nice catered lunch meetings.  Any additional food was packed up so it could be taken home to their families and not offered to staff.  Also, a yearly raffle was held and often management won the big prizes.  Some of the management were given company cars and they could be seen running errands in them during the weekend. All the desk and chairs  non-management got were used and broken down - management always got brand new ones.

Outside of the selfishness, management ruled with an 'iron fist' and were flat-out rude.  They was micromanagement across all departments. The CEO literally opened every piece of mail sent to the organization instead of managing the staff.   When in the office, the CEO would stare out of the windows to catch employees coming in late.  The Home Health management team was known to talk over staff and undermine other departments.  The CFO on many occasions walked off of site to the Claremont Village before lunch and was never seen until an hour before his time to go home.  Human Resources was the hiring and firing team, nothing else.

 The pay and benefits were terrible! Some years no raises were given and others a 3% max, even when one reduced costs and streamlined other processes.  The retirement plan offered very poor choices for investments.  For being a health organization, the insurance was VERY expensive out of pocket.  So much so, that my family opted to go to Kaiser directly to pay significantly less in premiums.

If you were not an RN or manager, you were treated poorly.  It often felt like RNs could do no bad.  I understand they are 'bringing in the money'; however, favoritism creates a poor work environment.  

I felt really bad for the Businesses Development team, administrative staff and IT department.

review_title: Management Team Difficult to work with
pros: The pay was decent, close to home, the position was one that made you feel good about what you were doing at the end of the day.
cons: No creativity, their way was the only way.if you want to be micromanaged, this is the place for you.  A very high turn over.
Managers don't support staff and favoritism over other employees. Layoffs are frequent.  No thanks for service to you as a worker if you get laid.  This place doesn't value your hard work.

job_title: Office Assistant At VNA in Rancho Cucamonga, CA
pros: Great benefits and wonderful and friendly co-workers.  Perks such as company lunches, ice cream socials, a 60th picnic
cons: Pay was a little on the low side.
horrible moral, complete turnaround of staff,  wage freeze for several years,  low and declining census, staff unhappy

job_title: Hospice Social Worker in Redlands, CA
cons: no where to move up in company, RAISE FREEZE for SEVEN YEARS
